content.description:
Sweet Nothing is a one-two-punch lowball that climbs solid edges over a poor landing.

Sit start with a low left hand edge and a right hand sidepull. From there, pull up to a left hand crimp (crux?), set the feet, dyno to the lip (crux?), throw a heel on, and top it out.
content.protection: Two pads would be prudent. The landing is pretty rough.
content.location: It climbs the eastern section of BOGO's north face.

content.description: Obvious arete on south side of boulder.  Sit-start on good holds on the arete.  Climb onto the south face and top out.  Test those holds!
content.location: Down-climb is the shelf on the road-facing side of the boulder

content.description:
Stable Element climbs a slightly overhung face by working through a perfect pair of slopers.

Sit start with hands matched on the arete. From there, pull up and set a right heel, gain and match hands on the shelf, then work left to the sloping rail, set and dyno to the lip (crux), throw a foot up, and top it out through the tree branches.
content.protection: Several pads, there are a number of rocks in and around the landing.
content.location: It climbs far west side of BOGO's north face.

content.description:
Mass Maker climbs a small but formidable face on a solid assortment of holds.

Sit start with hands matched on a low edge, a left heel, and the right foot flagged. From there, move a left hand to the sloping hueco, cross over to a great right hand sidepull in the same hueco, hit a good bump out left, paste a left foot, dyno with the right hand to the false lip, lock off, hold the swing, find the foot, and mantle atop the boulder.
content.protection: A few pads should work just fine, the immediate landing is great, but it does slope away behind the problem, and there are a few rocks behind as well.
content.location: It climbs the center of BOGO's west face.

content.description: Easy climb up the cliff-facing face of the boulder.
Small jugs end up on a thin, top crux.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter.  Watch out, for now the best looking hold is a loose rock.
content.location: On the west face of the boulder, start to the right of the base of the long crack that goes to the top.  Work to the bottom of the crack, then traverse back to the right and climb the thin face to the top.
